title: Bigraph percolation problems
abstract:
A bigraph $G$ is weakly norming if the $e(G)$th root of the density of $G$ in
$\lvert W\rvert$ is a norm in the space of bounded measurable functions
$W\colon\Omega\times\Lambda\to\mathbb{R}$. The only known technique, due to
Conlon--Lee, to show that a bigraph $G$ is weakly norming is to present a
cut-percolation sequence of $G$.
  In this paper, we identify a key obstacle for cut-percolation, which we call
fold-stability and we show that existence of a cut-percolating of a bigraph $G$
is equivalent to non-existence of non-monochromatic fold-stable colorings of
the edges of $G$.
